node.title: Man jailed for shooting and injuring police officer
node.description: A man who shot and injured a police officer at a routine traffic stop in Hamilton in July has been jailed for seven years and eight months.
node.content:
["A man who shot and injured a police officer at a routine traffic stop in Hamilton in July has been jailed for seven years and eight months.", "", "
Shannon Henry was sentenced this morning at the High Court in Hamilton. Photo: RNZ / Edward Gay
", "Shannon Henry, 23, pleaded guilty to wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm to the officer.", "He also faced charges of possession of a sawn-off shot gun.", "He was sentenced this morning at the High Court in Hamilton.", "The court heard that he targeted the officer's head and shot him from behind as the officer was taking cover.", "The officer, who was working alone, had pulled over a vehicle in a routine traffic stop in the suburb of Chartwell just before midnight on 9 July.", "The officer received over 100 lead pellet shots to his body.", "He underwent surgery but many of the pellets can't be removed from his body because of the risk of further nerve damage.", "Justice Harland imposed a non-parole period of half the prison term."]
